README.md.name: README.md

metadata.firstNLines:
This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) project bootstrapped with [`create-next-app`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/cli/create-next-app).

## Getting Started

First, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.

This project uses [`next/font`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing/fonts) to automatically optimize and load [Geist](https://vercel.com/font), a new font family for Vercel.

## Learn More

To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:

- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs) - learn about Next.js features and API.
- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn) - an interactive Next.js tutorial.

You can check out [the Next.js GitHub repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!

README.md.upperLevelSummary: Provides essential setup instructions and a project overview for the Next.js application to guide developer onboarding.

app/globals.css.name: globals.css
app/globals.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines global CSS variables and base reset styles imported by the root layout to establish the application's visual foundation.

app/layout.tsx.name: layout.tsx
app/layout.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Defines the application's root structure, global styles, and metadata as the primary layout for all pages.
app/layout.tsx.lowerLevelSummary: This file defines the root layout for a Next.js application, configuring global fonts and metadata. It wraps the application's children in HTML and body tags with applied font variables.

structure.name: geistSans
structure.summary: Initializes the Geist sans-serif font with specific CSS variables and subsets.

structure.name: geistMono
structure.summary: Initializes the Geist Mono font with specific CSS variables and subsets.

structure.name: metadata
structure.summary: Defines the application's SEO metadata including the title and description.

structure.name: RootLayout
structure.summary: The root layout component that provides the basic HTML structure and applies global font styles.

app/page.module.css.name: page.module.css
app/page.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines layout and typography styles for the main landing page component imported by app/page.tsx.

app/page.tsx.name: page.tsx

metadata.fileDocstring:
*
 * Home page component
 * Renders the calculator in a centered layout

app/page.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Acts as the application's primary home page entry point, integrating the core Calculator component into a styled layout.
app/page.tsx.lowerLevelSummary: This file defines the main entry point for the application's home page. It sets up the primary layout using CSS modules and renders the Calculator component within a main HTML element.

structure.name: Home
structure.summary: The main React component that renders the home page's structure and includes the Calculator component.

components/Button.module.css.name: Button.module.css
components/Button.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines the layout and visual styles for the Button component used in components/Button.tsx.

components/Button.tsx.name: Button.tsx
components/Button.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Exports a multi-variant calculator button component used in ButtonGrid.tsx and styled via Button.module.css.
components/Button.tsx.lowerLevelSummary: This file defines a reusable React Button component designed for a calculator interface. It utilizes CSS Modules for styling and accepts props for value, click handling, visual variants, and layout width.

structure.name: ButtonProps
structure.summary: Defines the TypeScript interface for the component's props, including value, onClick callback, variant, and wide flag.

structure.name: Button
structure.summary: The main functional component that renders a styled button element with dynamic class names based on its props.

structure.name: handleClick
structure.summary: An internal helper function that invokes the provided onClick callback with the button's specific value.

components/ButtonGrid.module.css.name: ButtonGrid.module.css
components/ButtonGrid.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines grid layout and responsive styling for the ButtonGrid component.

components/ButtonGrid.tsx.name: ButtonGrid.tsx

metadata.firstNLines:
import Button from "./Button";
import styles from "./ButtonGrid.module.css";

interface ButtonGridProps {
    onButtonClick: (value: string) => void;
}

/**
 * Calculator button grid component
 * Arranges buttons in a 4x5 grid layout
 */
export default function ButtonGrid({ onButtonClick }: ButtonGridProps) {
    const buttons = [
        { value: "C", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "±", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "%", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "÷", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "7", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "8", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "9", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "×", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "4", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "5", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "6", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "-", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "1", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "2", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "3", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "+", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "0", variant: "number" as const, wide: true },

components/ButtonGrid.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Arranges calculator buttons in a 4x5 grid for the Calculator component using individual Button components and local CSS modules.
components/ButtonGrid.tsx.lowerLevelSummary: This component defines a grid layout for a calculator's buttons by mapping over an array of button configurations. It passes click handlers and styling properties to child Button components to build the interactive interface.

structure.name: ButtonGridProps
structure.summary: Defines the interface for the component's props, specifically the click handler function.

structure.name: ButtonGrid
structure.summary: Main component that renders a grid of calculator buttons using a configuration array.

components/Calculator.module.css.name: Calculator.module.css
components/Calculator.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Provides responsive visual styling and layout definitions for the Calculator component.

components/Calculator.tsx.name: Calculator.tsx
components/Calculator.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Manages state and coordinates calculation logic across display and button components to provide the primary calculator interface for the main application page.
components/Calculator.tsx.lowerLevelSummary: A React component that implements calculator logic and state management. It utilizes hooks to handle numeric input, arithmetic operations, and UI updates, while delegating core math logic to external utility functions.

structure.name: Calculator
structure.summary: Main component that manages the calculator state, input handlers, and renders the display and button grid.

structure.name: handleNumber
structure.summary: Updates the display with numeric input, handling initial zeros and operand transitions.

structure.name: handleDecimal
structure.summary: Adds a decimal point to the current display value if one is not already present.

structure.name: handleOperator
structure.summary: Processes arithmetic operators, triggering pending calculations and updating the operation state.

structure.name: handleEquals
structure.summary: Finalizes the current calculation, updates the display and history, and resets the operand state.

structure.name: handleClear
structure.summary: Resets the calculator state to its initial default values.

structure.name: handleBackspace
structure.summary: Removes the last character from the display string or resets it to zero.

structure.name: handleToggleSign
structure.summary: Inverts the sign of the current numerical value on the display.

structure.name: handlePercent
structure.summary: Converts the current display value to its percentage equivalent.

structure.name: handleButtonClick
structure.summary: A central dispatcher that routes button inputs to their specific logic handlers based on the character value.

components/Display.module.css.name: Display.module.css
components/Display.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines visual styling and layout properties for the Display component to manage its appearance in the user interface.

components/Display.tsx.name: Display.tsx
components/Display.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Renders the calculator's current value and history for the Calculator component using localized CSS styles.
components/Display.tsx.lowerLevelSummary: This React component renders a calculator-style display consisting of a history line and a current value line. It uses CSS modules for styling and defines a specific interface for its props.

structure.name: DisplayProps
structure.summary: Defines the shape of the props for the Display component, including history and value strings.

structure.name: Display
structure.summary: Functional component that renders the calculation history and current input value within styled div elements.

eslint.config.mjs.name: eslint.config.mjs
eslint.config.mjs.upperLevelSummary: Configures project ESLint rules by integrating Next.js web vitals and TypeScript presets with custom global ignore patterns for build outputs.
eslint.config.mjs.lowerLevelSummary: This file configures ESLint for a Next.js project using the modern flat configuration format. It combines Next.js Core Web Vitals and TypeScript rule sets while specifying global ignore patterns for build directories and environment files.

structure.name: eslintConfig
structure.summary: Defines the primary ESLint configuration by merging Next.js presets and global ignore rules.

structure.name: globalIgnores
structure.summary: Specifies a list of directories and files, such as build outputs and environment declarations, to be excluded from linting.

lib/calculator.ts.name: calculator.ts

metadata.fileDocstring:
*
 * Calculator logic module
 * Contains pure mathematical functions for calculator operations

functionSignatures.name: add
functionSignatures.signature: export function add(a: number, b: number): number

functionSignatures.name: subtract
functionSignatures.signature: export function subtract(a: number, b: number): number

functionSignatures.name: multiply
functionSignatures.signature: export function multiply(a: number, b: number): number

functionSignatures.name: divide
functionSignatures.signature: export function divide(a: number, b: number): number

functionSignatures.name: calculate
functionSignatures.signature: export function calculate(a: number, operation: Operation, b: number): number

lib/calculator.ts.upperLevelSummary: Provides pure mathematical operations and input parsing utilities that serve as the core logic for the Calculator component.
lib/calculator.ts.lowerLevelSummary: This file provides a comprehensive set of arithmetic utilities and helper functions for a calculator application. It includes basic mathematical operations, a main calculation dispatcher, input parsing logic, and specialized string formatting for display purposes.

structure.name: add
structure.summary: Adds two numbers and returns the result.

structure.name: subtract
structure.summary: Subtracts the second number from the first and returns the result.

structure.name: multiply
structure.summary: Multiplies two numbers and returns the result.

structure.name: divide
structure.summary: Divides two numbers with error handling for division by zero.

structure.name: Operation
structure.summary: Defines the allowed mathematical operator symbols for calculations.

structure.name: calculate
structure.summary: Executes a mathematical operation on two numbers based on the specified operator.

structure.name: parseInput
structure.summary: Safely converts a string input into a floating-point number, defaulting to zero.

structure.name: formatDisplay
structure.summary: Formats a numeric value into a string suitable for a calculator display, handling precision and scientific notation.

next-env.d.ts.name: next-env.d.ts
next-env.d.ts.upperLevelSummary: Provides global TypeScript type definitions for Next.js features and routing to ensure project-wide environment compatibility and type safety.
next-env.d.ts.lowerLevelSummary: This is a Next.js environment declaration file used to ensure TypeScript recognizes Next.js specific types and features. Currently, the file contains only empty lines and does not define any functions, classes, or blocks.

next.config.ts.name: next.config.ts
next.config.ts.upperLevelSummary: Defines and exports global configuration settings to customize the Next.js application's build and runtime behavior.
next.config.ts.lowerLevelSummary: This file defines the configuration settings for a Next.js application using TypeScript. It exports a nextConfig object that implements the NextConfig type, serving as the central point for customizing build and runtime behavior.

structure.name: nextConfig
structure.summary: Defines the configuration object for the Next.js application.

package-lock.json.name: package-lock.json
package-lock.json.upperLevelSummary: Records the exact versions of all project dependencies and their sub-dependencies to ensure consistent and reproducible builds across different environments.

package.json.name: package.json
package.json.upperLevelSummary: Defines project metadata, build scripts, and core dependencies for the Next.js-based calculator application.
